knowledge.progressSummary: IN-PROGRESS: Core Sidon infrastructure proved. The erdos_14a_implies_not_14b theorem may need reformulation.
builtItems: sidon_all_unique - Sidon sets have all unique sums PROVED (Erdos14UniqueSums.lean:88)
empty_repCount - empty set has 0 reps PROVED (Erdos14UniqueSums.lean:173)
sidon_size_bound - Sidon sets have O(√N) elements (AXIOM, Erdős-Turán)
insights: Erdős #14 asks two related questions about uniquely representable sums
Sidon sets (B₂ sequences) have ALL sums unique, but are sparse (O(√N))
Key technique: wlog for a ≤ b normalization in pair counting
ncard of singleton set = 1, enabling clean repCount proofs
Consecutive integers {1,...,n} always have non-unique sums (e.g., 4 = 1+3 = 2+2)
FORMALIZATION ISSUE: erdos_14a as stated (∃C>0, U(N)≥C·N^{1/2-ε}) may be too weak
The current erdos_14a allows C(ε)→0 as ε→0, which doesn't contradict erdos_14b
Stronger formulation needed: U(N)/N^{1/2-ε}→∞ for all ε>0 (Tendsto atTop atTop)
mathlibGaps: No direct lemma for counting pairs with property in finite product sets
nextSteps: Consider reformulating erdos_14a with stronger Tendsto atTop atTop
